Class WordCount1

  • java.lang.Object
    • WordCount1

  • public class WordCount1
extends Object
    WordCount1 is intended to be a mostly straightforward translation of the K&R word counting program (main routine on p. 140).

    This translation implements the tnode struct as a separate class named TreeNode1 with public fields word, count, left, and right. StringBuilder is used for character buffers. The mismatch between bytes and INICODE chars is not fully handled, as each byte that is input is individually translated to a char.

    Version:
    20130619
    Author:
    Tom Bylander

      addtree adds (or modifies) a node for a word w into the tree or subtree with root p.
      static int getch()
      getch returns a character removed from buf, or, if buf is empty, getch returns a character from standard input (or EOF).
      static int getWord(StringBuilder word)
      getWord stores the next word or non-space character from standard input into its StringBuilder parameter.
      static void main(String[] args)
      The main method reads every word from standard input, stores it in a binary tree (which remembers how many times it appears), and prints the words and their counts back out in lexiographic order.
      static void treePrint(TreeNode1 p)
      treePrint prints the tree p in-order on standard output.
      static void ungetch(int c)
      ungetch appends a character to buf.

    • Field Detail

      • EOF

        public static final int EOF
        EOF is a class constant. It is -1 because that is what is returned for end of file by System.in.read().
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • WordCount1

        public WordCount1()

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(String[] args)
        The main method reads every word from standard input, stores it in a binary tree (which remembers how many times it appears), and prints the words and their counts back out in lexiographic order.

        Corresponds to K&R, p. 140.

      • getch

        public static int getch()
        getch returns a character removed from buf, or, if buf is empty, getch returns a character from standard input (or EOF).

        Corresponds to K&R, p. 79.

        Returns:
        EOF or an int representation of the character.

      • ungetch

        public static void ungetch(int c)
        ungetch appends a character to buf.

        Corresponds to K&R, p. 79

        Parameters:
        c - an int representation of the character

      • getWord

        public static int getWord(StringBuilder word)
        getWord stores the next word or non-space character from standard input into its StringBuilder parameter. It returns the int representation of the first character or EOF. A word is interpreted as any string of letters delimited by nonletters.

        Corresponds to K&R, p. 136.

        Parameters:
        word - the buffer for the word
        Returns:
        the first character of the word or EOF.

      • addTree

        public static TreeNode1 addTree(TreeNode1 p,
                String w)
        addtree adds (or modifies) a node for a word w into the tree or subtree with root p. If the word is already in the tree, only the count is incremented; no new node is created.

        Corresponds to K&R, p. 141.

        Parameters:
        p - the root of the subtree, possibly null
        w - the word to be added into the tree
        Returns:
        the TreeNode1 p, or, if p is null, a new TreeNode1 object. The latter is needed to fill in a null field of the parent.

      • treePrint

        public static void treePrint(TreeNode1 p)
        treePrint prints the tree p in-order on standard output.

        Corresponds to K&R, p. 142.

        Parameters:
        p - the TreeNode1 root of the tree or subtree.
